result.execSummary:
The defendant Marian Tomko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advixed that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of Extended Supervision as imposed in count one. Failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 74 days.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Marian Tomko in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Marian Tomko in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 22/24.
As to counts 1 and 2 as charged:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered pleas of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  The state has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
Count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 34 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 74 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 14 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 20 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges as ordered in count 2 and in counts 2 and 3 in 16CF4751 as a condition of ES.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
-Complete Anger Management or Batterers Intervention programming.
-Mental health assessment and treatment.
-Possess no illegal drugs or drug paraphanalia.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random urine screens.
-ADOA treatment.
-No contact with victim in 16CF4751, Luis R.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
             Pretrial Credit
             Notice of Voting Ineligibility
Count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1, with credit for 74 days time served.    The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of extended supervision as imposed in count 1 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.

Defendant Marian Tomko in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Marian Tomko in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
